basic.description: Developing new renewable energy options using biomass requires an understanding of feedstocks and technologies, as well as the social and economic factors that drive the industry. Value-added options for biorefining, including the combination of material, chemical, and energy products with environmental services such as phytoremediation and carbon sequestration, are explored in the Canadian context.
basic.subject: GPHY
basic.title: Bioenergy and Biorefining in Canada

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite    Level 3 in a GPHY plan, or permission of the Department.
